other_tests.findings: Light microscopy showed focal fibrinoid necrosis and an early crescentic pattern of injury; strong staining for C3 and IgA on immunofluorescence microscopy; moderate effacement of podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: By the third hospital day, the patient's creatinine level had risen to 3.2 mg per deciliter. Renal function gradually improved in the weeks after discharge and was back to baseline approximately 6 months after the onset of the infection.

other_tests.findings: Purulent fluid that was too viscous for pH analysis; glucose level in pleural fluid was 5 mg per deciliter; LDH higher than 2500 U per liter; Gram's staining showed 4+ polymorphonuclear leukocytes and no organisms.
